org.jlinalg.optimise
Interface Optimiser<RESIDUAL extends IRingElement<?>>

Type Parameters:
RESIDUAL - the type of the residual
All Known Implementing Classes:
RandomGradientDescent
public interface Optimiser<RESIDUAL extends IRingElement<?>>

The contract for an optimiser. The target (that is the class that is optimised) has to provide the methods as specified in Target. The following steps are necessary:

  • The target function (class) has to implement Target
  • The class implementing Optimiser) has to be instantiated and referenced to the target.
  • Call method optimise() to start the optimisation.
  • Wait for the created thread to terminate (or interrupt it).
  • Inspect the target and/or the optimiser.

Author:
Georg Thimm

Method Detail

setTarget

void setTarget(Target<RESIDUAL> target)
Set the Target for the optimiser. Does not start the optimisation.

Parameters:
target - The target for the optimisation

optimise

java.lang.Thread optimise()
run the optimiser in the background. This is done in a second thread and this function return the id of the thread doing the execution.

Returns:
the thread that does the optimisation.

getState

Optimiser.State getState()
Returns:
The state of the optimisation.

getResidual

RESIDUAL getResidual()
Returns:
The residual for the current state of the target. This is intended for an observation of the progress of the optimisation only.

getMaxOptimisationSteps

int getMaxOptimisationSteps()
Returns:
the maximal number of optimisation steps taken by the optimiser

setMaxOptimisationSteps

void setMaxOptimisationSteps(int maxOptimisationSteps)
Parameters:
maxOptimisationSteps - the maxOptimisationSteps to set

getOptimisationStepsTaken

int getOptimisationStepsTaken()
Returns:
the number of steps taken during the last call of optimise(). If optimise did not yet terminate, this is the current number of steps. -1 if no optimisation was executed.
